text: Hi All, Yesterday I set up the local dev enviroment, and I noticed something with the watcher. Adding files and changing them works fine, however deleting them doesn’t (for example images in my img folder). According to the documentation it should. Any suggestions or is this simply a bug?

I’ve made a couple of changes to the project that I think are improvements (hopefully).

<https://github.com/paulca55/HubSpot-local-development#changelog>
You need to add `--remove` to the command. We found that automatically removing was a bit dangerous so wanted to make it explicit. Sounds like we also need to update the docs.
Nice!  I’m hoping to find some time to give this a go.  I’ve been working with a workflow based off Ryan Absalon’s repo for the last year or so, but yours is looking cleaner than what I’ve got

Thanks :slightly_smiling_face: I actually work with Ryan but I’ll be getting a lot of the HubSpot work with being a junior, so mine is based on his ideas, and he actually advised me on the regex inclusion.
Awesome, thanks!

Is this part:
```<!--
  templateType: global_partial
  label: Page Footer
-->```
actually relevant to making that a global_partial
I’m trying to figure out how to make something a global partial but can’t find anything about it
that’s from the CMS boilerplate but I get an error in the design manager
an `include` seemed to work just as well
not sure why the example uses a global_partial or how to make one but it would be good to know

it looks like global_partial is only available for local dev, so does that mean that if you use them in the boilerplate example you then would have to an error/warning when using the online design manager?
Wow.  I owe him at least a couple pints.  That workflow was by far the fastest way I’ve found to develop in HubSpot.  I tried many options before I stumbled on that repo
be cool to be able to add a more specific identifier for devs working locally to be displayed in the revision history on the design manager
we’re working on this.
of course you are...of course you are. i never have new ideas.
damn smart people and your ways

Yeah it’s definitely a great tool, especially since he created it before the HubSpot Local Dev Tools came around. I’m hoping mine can be just as useful as it’s slightly more up to date and has a few more features. Would love to hear what you think once you get chance :slightly_smiling_face:
Back in the dark ages, those of us who wanted to dev locally had to work with Local HUBL Server
I take it that it wasn’t a great experience? haha
It was better than nothing, but the file structure for local was completely different than within a portal as well as a number of other limitations.  Things are a lot better than they once were
Yeah I’m really liking where they are taking things now, it’s great.
I’m sure the people at HubSpot would be happy to hear that.  They’ve invested a lot of time/resources into the developer experience over the years.
Yeah I’m glad I came into developing with HubSpot when I did, it’s an exciting time.

A few things to unpack here:
1. Global partials do change the editing experience
2. In the design manager, we also are switching to showing the annotations 
Both of these are new features that are gradually being rolled out.
